segment.source: description: This article discusses how to use camera profiles to discover and manage the capabilities of different video capture devices.
segment.target: description: This article discusses how to use camera profiles to discover and manage the capabilities of different video capture devices.

segment.source: title: Camera profiles
segment.target: title: Camera profiles

segment.source: Camera profiles
segment.target: Camera profiles

segment.source: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
segment.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

segment.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]
segment.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]

segment.source: This article discusses how to use camera profiles to discover and manage the capabilities of different video capture devices.
segment.target: This article discusses how to use camera profiles to discover and manage the capabilities of different video capture devices.

segment.source: This article builds on concepts and code discussed in Capture Photos and Video with MediaCapture, which describes the steps for implementing basic photo and video capture.
segment.target: This article builds on concepts and code discussed in Capture Photos and Video with MediaCapture, which describes the steps for implementing basic photo and video capture.

segment.source: It is recommended that you familiarize yourself with the basic media capture pattern in that article before moving on to more advanced capture scenarios.
segment.target: It is recommended that you familiarize yourself with the basic media capture pattern in that article before moving on to more advanced capture scenarios.

segment.source: The code in this article assumes that your app already has an instance of MediaCapture that has been properly initialized.
segment.target: The code in this article assumes that your app already has an instance of MediaCapture that has been properly initialized.

segment.source: About camera profiles
segment.target: About camera profiles

segment.source: Cameras on different devices support different capabilities including the set of supported capture resolutions, frame rate for video captures, and whether HDR or variable frame rate captures are supported.
segment.target: Cameras on different devices support different capabilities including the set of supported capture resolutions, frame rate for video captures, and whether HDR or variable frame rate captures are supported.

segment.source: The Universal Windows Platform (UWP) media capture framework stores this set of capabilities in a MediaCaptureVideoProfileMediaDescription.
segment.target: The Universal Windows Platform (UWP) media capture framework stores this set of capabilities in a MediaCaptureVideoProfileMediaDescription.

segment.source: A camera profile, represented by a MediaCaptureVideoProfile object, has three collections of media descriptions; one for photo capture, one for video capture, and another for video preview.
segment.target: A camera profile, represented by a MediaCaptureVideoProfile object, has three collections of media descriptions; one for photo capture, one for video capture, and another for video preview.

segment.source: Before initializing your MediaCapture object, you can query the capture devices on the current device to see what profiles are supported.
segment.target: Before initializing your MediaCapture object, you can query the capture devices on the current device to see what profiles are supported.

segment.source: When you select a supported profile, you know that the capture device supports all of the capabilities in the profile's media descriptions.
segment.target: When you select a supported profile, you know that the capture device supports all of the capabilities in the profile's media descriptions.

segment.source: This eliminates the need for a trial and error approach to determining which combinations of capabilities are supported on a particular device.
segment.target: This eliminates the need for a trial and error approach to determining which combinations of capabilities are supported on a particular device.

segment.source: In the article on basic media capture, Capture Photos and Video with MediaCapture, the MediaCaptureInitializationSettings used to initialize the media capture is created with only the capture device's ID string, the minimum amount of data required for initialization.
segment.target: In the article on basic media capture, Capture Photos and Video with MediaCapture, the MediaCaptureInitializationSettings used to initialize the media capture is created with only the capture device's ID string, the minimum amount of data required for initialization.

segment.source: [!code-csBasicInitExample]
segment.target: [!code-csBasicInitExample]

segment.source: The code examples in this article replace this minimal initialization with the discovery of camera profiles supporting various capabilities, which are then used to initialize the media capture device.
segment.target: The code examples in this article replace this minimal initialization with the discovery of camera profiles supporting various capabilities, which are then used to initialize the media capture device.

segment.source: Find a video device that supports camera profiles
segment.target: Find a video device that supports camera profiles

segment.source: Before searching for supported camera profiles, you should find a capture device that supports the use of camera profiles.
segment.target: Before searching for supported camera profiles, you should find a capture device that supports the use of camera profiles.

segment.source: The GetVideoProfileSupportedDeviceIdAsync helper method defined in the example below uses the DeviceInformaion.FindAllAsync method to retrieve a list of all available video capture devices.
segment.target: The GetVideoProfileSupportedDeviceIdAsync helper method defined in the example below uses the DeviceInformaion.FindAllAsync method to retrieve a list of all available video capture devices.

segment.source: It loops through all of the devices in the list, calling the static method, IsVideoProfileSupported, for each device to see if it supports video profiles.
segment.target: It loops through all of the devices in the list, calling the static method, IsVideoProfileSupported, for each device to see if it supports video profiles.

segment.source: Also, the EnclosureLocation.Panel property for each device, allowing you to specify wether you want a camera on the front or back of the device.
segment.target: Also, the EnclosureLocation.Panel property for each device, allowing you to specify wether you want a camera on the front or back of the device.

segment.source: If a device that supports camera profiles is found on the specified panel, the Id value, containing the device's ID string, is returned.
segment.target: If a device that supports camera profiles is found on the specified panel, the Id value, containing the device's ID string, is returned.

segment.source: [!code-csGetVideoProfileSupportedDeviceIdAsync]
segment.target: [!code-csGetVideoProfileSupportedDeviceIdAsync]

segment.source: If the device ID returned from the GetVideoProfileSupportedDeviceIdAsync helper method is null or an empty string, there is no device on the specified panel that supports camera profiles.
segment.target: If the device ID returned from the GetVideoProfileSupportedDeviceIdAsync helper method is null or an empty string, there is no device on the specified panel that supports camera profiles.

segment.source: In this case, you should initialize your media capture device without using profiles.
segment.target: In this case, you should initialize your media capture device without using profiles.

segment.source: [!code-csGetDeviceWithProfileSupport]
segment.target: [!code-csGetDeviceWithProfileSupport]

segment.source: Select a profile based on supported resolution and frame rate
segment.target: Select a profile based on supported resolution and frame rate

segment.source: To select a profile with particular capabilities, such as with the ability to achieve a particular resolution and frame rate, you should first call the helper method defined above to get the ID of a capture device that supports using camera profiles.
segment.target: To select a profile with particular capabilities, such as with the ability to achieve a particular resolution and frame rate, you should first call the helper method defined above to get the ID of a capture device that supports using camera profiles.

segment.source: Create a new MediaCaptureInitializationSettings object, passing in the selected device ID.
segment.target: Create a new MediaCaptureInitializationSettings object, passing in the selected device ID.

segment.source: Next, call the static method MediaCapture.FindAllVideoProfiles to get a list of all camera profiles supported by the device.
segment.target: Next, call the static method MediaCapture.FindAllVideoProfiles to get a list of all camera profiles supported by the device.

segment.source: This example uses a Linq query method, included in the using System.Linq namespace, to select a profile that contains a SupportedRecordMediaDescription object where the Width, Height, and FrameRate properties match the requested values.
segment.target: This example uses a Linq query method, included in the using System.Linq namespace, to select a profile that contains a SupportedRecordMediaDescription object where the Width, Height, and FrameRate properties match the requested values.

segment.source: If a match is found, VideoProfile and RecordMediaDescription of the MediaCaptureInitializationSettings are set to the values from the anonymous type returned from the Linq query.
segment.target: If a match is found, VideoProfile and RecordMediaDescription of the MediaCaptureInitializationSettings are set to the values from the anonymous type returned from the Linq query.

segment.source: If no match is found, the default profile is used.
segment.target: If no match is found, the default profile is used.

segment.source: [!code-csFindWVGA30FPSProfile]
segment.target: [!code-csFindWVGA30FPSProfile]

segment.source: Once you populated the MediaCaptureInitializationSettings with your desired camera profile, you simply call InitializeAsync on your media capture object to configure it to the desired profile.
segment.target: Once you populated the MediaCaptureInitializationSettings with your desired camera profile, you simply call InitializeAsync on your media capture object to configure it to the desired profile.

segment.source: [!code-csInitCaptureWithProfile]
segment.target: [!code-csInitCaptureWithProfile]

segment.source: Select a profile that supports concurrence
segment.target: Select a profile that supports concurrence

segment.source: You can use camera profiles to determine if a device supports video capture from multiple cameras concurrently.
segment.target: You can use camera profiles to determine if a device supports video capture from multiple cameras concurrently.

segment.source: For this scenario, you will need to create two sets of capture objects, one for the front camera and one for the back.
segment.target: For this scenario, you will need to create two sets of capture objects, one for the front camera and one for the back.

segment.source: For each camera, create a MediaCapture, a MediaCaptureInitializationSettings, and a string to hold the capture device ID.
segment.target: For each camera, create a MediaCapture, a MediaCaptureInitializationSettings, and a string to hold the capture device ID.

segment.source: Also, add a boolean variable that will track whether concurrence is supported.
segment.target: Also, add a boolean variable that will track whether concurrence is supported.

segment.source: [!code-csConcurrencySetup]
segment.target: [!code-csConcurrencySetup]

segment.source: The static method MediaCapture.FindConcurrentProfiles returns a list of the camera profiles that are supported by the specified capture device that can also supports concurrence.
segment.target: The static method MediaCapture.FindConcurrentProfiles returns a list of the camera profiles that are supported by the specified capture device that can also supports concurrence.

segment.source: Use a Linq query to find a profile that supports concurrence and that is supported by both the front and back camera.
segment.target: Use a Linq query to find a profile that supports concurrence and that is supported by both the front and back camera.

segment.source: If a profile that meets theses requirements is found, set the profile on each of the MediaCaptureInitializationSettings objects and set the boolean concurrence tracking variable to true.
segment.target: If a profile that meets theses requirements is found, set the profile on each of the MediaCaptureInitializationSettings objects and set the boolean concurrence tracking variable to true.

segment.source: [!code-csFindConcurrencyDevices]
segment.target: [!code-csFindConcurrencyDevices]

segment.source: Call MediaCapture.InitializeAsync for the primary camera for your app scenario.
segment.target: Call MediaCapture.InitializeAsync for the primary camera for your app scenario.

segment.source: If concurrence is supported, initialize the second camera as well.
segment.target: If concurrence is supported, initialize the second camera as well.

segment.source: [!code-csInitConcurrentMediaCaptures]
segment.target: [!code-csInitConcurrentMediaCaptures]

segment.source: Use known profiles to find a profile that supports HDR video
segment.target: Use known profiles to find a profile that supports HDR video

segment.source: Selecting a profile that supports HDR begins like the other scenarios.
segment.target: Selecting a profile that supports HDR begins like the other scenarios.

segment.source: Create a a MediaCaptureInitializationSettings and a string to hold the capture device ID.
segment.target: Create a a MediaCaptureInitializationSettings and a string to hold the capture device ID.

segment.source: Add a boolean variable that will track whether HDR video is supported.
segment.target: Add a boolean variable that will track whether HDR video is supported.

segment.source: [!code-csGetHdrProfileSetup]
segment.target: [!code-csGetHdrProfileSetup]

segment.source: Use the GetVideoProfileSupportedDeviceIdAsync helper method defined above to get the device ID for a capture device that supports camera profiles.
segment.target: Use the GetVideoProfileSupportedDeviceIdAsync helper method defined above to get the device ID for a capture device that supports camera profiles.

segment.source: [!code-csFindDeviceHDR]
segment.target: [!code-csFindDeviceHDR]

segment.source: The static method MediaCapture.FindKnownVideoProfiles returns the camera profiles supported by the specified device that is categorized by the specified KnownVideoProfile value.
segment.target: The static method MediaCapture.FindKnownVideoProfiles returns the camera profiles supported by the specified device that is categorized by the specified KnownVideoProfile value.

segment.source: For this scenario, the VideoRecording value is specified to limit the returned camera profiles to ones that support video recording.
segment.target: For this scenario, the VideoRecording value is specified to limit the returned camera profiles to ones that support video recording.

segment.source: Loop through the returned list of camera profiles.
segment.target: Loop through the returned list of camera profiles.

segment.source: For each camera profile, loop through each VideoProfileMediaDescription in the profile checking to see if the IsHdrVideoSupported property is true.
segment.target: For each camera profile, loop through each VideoProfileMediaDescription in the profile checking to see if the IsHdrVideoSupported property is true.

segment.source: Once a suitable media description is found, break out of the loop and assign the profile and description objects to the MediaCaptureInitializationSettings object.
segment.target: Once a suitable media description is found, break out of the loop and assign the profile and description objects to the MediaCaptureInitializationSettings object.

segment.source: [!code-csFindHDRProfile]
segment.target: [!code-csFindHDRProfile]

segment.source: Determine if a device supports simultaneous photo and video capture
segment.target: Determine if a device supports simultaneous photo and video capture

segment.source: Many devices support capturing photos and video simultaneously.
segment.target: Many devices support capturing photos and video simultaneously.

segment.source: To determine if a capture device supports this, call MediaCapture.FindAllVideoProfiles to get all of the camera profiles supported by the device.
segment.target: To determine if a capture device supports this, call MediaCapture.FindAllVideoProfiles to get all of the camera profiles supported by the device.

segment.source: Use a link query to find a profile that has at least one entry for both SupportedPhotoMediaDescription and SupportedRecordMediaDescription which means that the profile supports simultaneous capture.
segment.target: Use a link query to find a profile that has at least one entry for both SupportedPhotoMediaDescription and SupportedRecordMediaDescription which means that the profile supports simultaneous capture.

segment.source: [!code-csGetPhotoAndVideoSupport]
segment.target: [!code-csGetPhotoAndVideoSupport]

segment.source: You can refine this query to look for profiles that support specific resolutions or other capabilities in addition to simultaneous video record.
segment.target: You can refine this query to look for profiles that support specific resolutions or other capabilities in addition to simultaneous video record.

segment.source: You can also use the MediaCapture.FindKnownVideoProfiles and specify the BalancedVideoAndPhoto value to retrieve profiles that support simultaneous capture, but querying all profiles will provide more complete results.
segment.target: You can also use the MediaCapture.FindKnownVideoProfiles and specify the BalancedVideoAndPhoto value to retrieve profiles that support simultaneous capture, but querying all profiles will provide more complete results.
